member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PresentationElementSerializer.Read(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: PresentationElement is abstract and cannot be instantiated, so this method throws NotSupportedException.
member.remarks: When this method is called, caller guarantees that the passed-in XML reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the PresentationElement element that is about to be deserialized. The method needs to ensure that when it returns, the reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the next sibling element, or the close tag of the parent element (or EOF).
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory PresentationElement instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PresentationElementSerializer.ReadPropertiesFromAttributes(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This method deserializes all properties that are serialized as XML attributes.
member.remarks: Because this method only handles properties serialized as XML attributes, the passed-in reader shouldn't be moved inside this method. The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned on the open XML tag of the current element being deserialized.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory PresentationElement instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PresentationElementSerializer.ReadElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This methods deserializes nested XML elements inside the passed-in element.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the current element does have nested XML elements, and the call will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read as many child XML elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory PresentationElement instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PresentationElementSerializer.ReadChildElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PresentationElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This method deserializes all child model elements.
member.remarks: The caller will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element to deserialized. This method will read as many child elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
In-memory PresentationElement instance that will get the deserialized data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeElementSerializer.Read(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: ShapeElement is abstract and cannot be instantiated, so this method throws NotSupportedException.
member.remarks: When this method is called, caller guarantees that the passed-in XML reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the ShapeElement element that is about to be deserialized. The method needs to ensure that when it returns, the reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the next sibling element, or the close tag of the parent element (or EOF).
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory ShapeElement instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeElementSerializer.ReadElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This methods deserializes nested XML elements inside the passed-in element.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the current element does have nested XML elements, and the call will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read as many child XML elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory ShapeElement instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.remarks: The caller will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element to deserialized. This method will read as many child elements as it can. member.summary: Reads all instances of relationship ParentShapeHasRelativeChildShapes.
member.remarks: The caller will position the reader at the open tag of the first XML element inside the relationship tag, so it can be either the first instance, or a bogus tag. This method will deserialize all instances and ignore all bogus tags. When the method returns, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the relationship (or EOF if somehow that happens).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeElementSerializer.CustomGetMonikerQualifier(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.DomainXmlSerializerDirectory,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement)
member.summary: A domain class can be monikerized in different ways: standard /qualifier/key mechanism, custom moniker, or element ID. If the domain class is serialized using standard /qualifier/key mechanism, this method returns the qualifier of the moniker; if the domain class uses other ways for monikerization, this method returns empty string.
member.param: Directory to look up serializer based on model element type.
ShapeElement instance to get moniker qualifier from.
member.returns: Value of this element's moniker qualifier property, if it has one, or the value of the container's moniker qualifier property. Or empty string if this element is not monikerized using standard /qualifier/key mechanism.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeElementSerializer.ReadMoveableDecoratorHostShapeInstances(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads all instances of class MoveableDecoratorHostShape.
member.remarks: The caller will position the reader at the open tag of the first XML element inside the "moveableDecoratorhostShape" tag, so it can be either the first instance, or a bogus tag. This method will deserialize all instances and ignore all bogus tags. When the method returns, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the relationship (or EOF if somehow that happens).
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory ShapeElement instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.returns: Created NodeShape instance, or null if the reader is not pointing to a serialized NodeShape instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.LinkShapeSerializer.ReadElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This methods deserializes nested XML elements inside the passed-in element.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the current element does have nested XML elements, and the call will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read as many child XML elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory LinkShape instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.LinkShapeSerializer.ReadChildElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.LinkShape,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This method deserializes all child model elements.
member.remarks: The caller will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element to deserialized. This method will read as many child elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
In-memory LinkShape instance that will get the deserialized data.

member.summary: BinaryLinkShape is abstract and cannot be instantiated, so this method throws NotSupportedException.
member.remarks: When this method is called, caller guarantees that the passed-in XML reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the BinaryLinkShape element that is about to be deserialized. The method needs to ensure that when it returns, the reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the next sibling element, or the close tag of the parent element (or EOF).

member.param: Serialization context.

XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.BinaryLinkShapeSerializerBase.TryCreateInstance(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,System.Xml.XmlReader,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Partition)
member.summary: This method creates a correct instance of BinaryLinkShape based on the tag currently pointed by the reader. If the reader is positioned at a serialized BinaryLinkShape, a new BinaryLinkShape instance will be created in the given partition, otherwise null is returned.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned at open XML tag of the next element being read. This method should not move the reader; the reader should remain at the same position when this method returns.
member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
Partition in which new elements should be created.
member.returns: Created BinaryLinkShape instance, or null if the reader is not pointing to a serialized BinaryLinkShape instance.

member.summary: A domain class can be monikerized in different ways: standard /qualifier/key mechanism, custom moniker, or element ID. PortShape instance to get moniker qualifier from.
member.returns: Value of this element's moniker qualifier property, if it has one, or the value of the container's moniker qualifier property. Or empty string if this element is not monikerized using standard /qualifier/key mechanism.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.CompartmentShapeSerializer.TryCreateInstance(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,System.Xml.XmlReader,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Partition)
member.summary: This method creates a correct instance of CompartmentShape based on the tag currently pointed by the reader. If the reader is positioned at a serialized CompartmentShape, a new CompartmentShape instance will be created in the given partition, otherwise null is returned.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned at open XML tag of the next element being read. This method should not move the reader; the reader should remain at the same position when this method returns.
member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
Partition in which new elements should be created.
member.returns: Created CompartmentShape instance, or null if the reader is not pointing to a serialized CompartmentShape instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PortSerializer.Read(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Port is abstract and cannot be instantiated, so this method throws NotSupportedException.
member.remarks: When this method is called, caller guarantees that the passed-in XML reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the Port element that is about to be deserialized. The method needs to ensure that when it returns, the reader is positioned at the open XML tag of the next sibling element, or the close tag of the parent element (or EOF).
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory Port instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PortSerializer.TryCreateInstance(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,System.Xml.XmlReader,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Partition)
member.summary: This method creates a correct instance of Port based on the tag currently pointed by the reader. If the reader is positioned at a serialized Port, a new Port instance will be created in the given partition, otherwise null is returned.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned at open XML tag of the next element being read. This method should not move the reader; the reader should remain at the same position when this method returns.
member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
Partition in which new elements should be created.
member.returns: Created Port instance, or null if the reader is not pointing to a serialized Port instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PortSerializer.CreateInstance(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,System.Xml.XmlReader,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Partition)
member.summary: This method creates an instance of Port based on the tag currently pointed by the reader. The reader is guaranteed (by the caller) to be pointed at a serialized instance of Port.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned at open XML tag of the ModelRoot instance being read. This method should not move the reader; the reader should remain at the same position when this method returns.
member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
Partition in which new Port instance should be created.
member.returns: Created Port instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PortSerializer.GetMonikerQualifier(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.DomainXmlSerializerDirectory,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement)
member.summary: A domain class can be monikerized in different ways: standard /qualifier/key mechanism, custom moniker, or element ID. If the domain class is serialized using standard /qualifier/key mechanism, this method returns the qualifier of the moniker; if the domain class uses other ways for monikerization, this method returns empty string.
member.param: Directory to look up serializer based on model element type.
Port instance to get moniker qualifier from.
member.returns: Value of this element's moniker qualifier property, if it has one, or the value of the container's moniker qualifier property. Or empty string if this element is not monikerized using standard /qualifier/key mechanism.

If the reader is positioned at a serialized ElementListCompartment, a new ElementListCompartment instance will be created in the given partition, otherwise null is returned.

member.param: Serialization context.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.
Partition in which new elements should be created.
member.returns: Created ElementListCompartment instance, or null if the reader is not pointing to a serialized ElementListCompartment instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DecoratorHostShapeSerializerBase.ReadElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This methods deserializes nested XML elements inside the passed-in element.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the current element does have nested XML elements, and the call will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read as many child XML elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory DecoratorHostShape instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the current element does have nested XML elements, and the call will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read as many child XML elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ParentShapeContainsNestedChildShapesSerializer.ReadTargetRolePlayer(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This method reads the target role player NestedChildShapes.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read only one target role player instance. The method will skip any child XML element it encounters until it reaches: 1) The open tag of the target role player. 2) The end tag of the parent element (dangling relationship). 3) EOF (dangling relationship). After the call, the reader is positioned at: 1) The open tag of the next child element after the target role player. 2) The end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory ParentShapeContainsNestedChildShapes instance that will link to the target ShapeElement instance.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned at open XML tag of the next element being read. This method should not move the reader; the reader should remain at the same position when this method returns.

Partition in which new elements should be created.

member.summary: This method deserializes all properties that are serialized as XML attributes.
member.remarks: Because this method only handles properties serialized as XML attributes, the passed-in reader shouldn't be moved inside this method. The caller will guarantee that the reader is positioned on the open XML tag of the current element being deserialized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.LinkConnectsToNodeSerializer.ReadElements(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SerializationContext,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.ModelElement,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: This methods deserializes nested XML elements inside the passed-in element.
member.remarks: The caller will guarantee that the current element does have nested XML elements, and the call will position the reader at the open tag of the first child XML element. This method will read as many child XML elements as it can. It returns under three circumstances: 1) When an unknown child XML element is encountered. In this case, this method will position the reader at the open tag of the unknown element. This implies that if the first child XML element is unknown, this method should return immediately and do nothing. 2) When all child XML elemnets are read. In this case, the reader will be positioned at the end tag of the parent element. 3) EOF.
member.param: Serialization context.
In-memory LinkConnectsToNode instance that will get the deserialized data.
XmlReader to read serialized data from.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphicsTranslator
member.summary: Temporarily applies a translation on a Graphics object, restoring when Dispose() is called.
member.remarks:
This class will: (1) save the graphics state. (2) call TranslateTransform on the graphics object. On Dispose(), this class will restore the graphics state.
BeginContainer/EndContainer are not used because they reset several settings, including PageUnit and clipping region.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GraphicsTranslator class.
member.param: The graphics object on which the translation will be applied.
x component of the translation in world units
y component of the translation in world units
member.remarks: The Graphics object's state will be saved in the constructor and restored when the GraphicsTranslator's Dispose() is called.

member.remarks: Changing the position of the decorator does not automatically cause the diagram to update. If the decorator exists outside the shape, ConfigureHostShape and RepositionHostShape must be called for all host shapes hosting this decorator.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeField
member.summary: Defines the base class for shape fields, which are components of a ShapeElement that are capable of drawing and editing. ShapeFields are analogous to Controls on a Form.
member.remarks: If you want to display items such as text or images within a ShapeElement, instantiate ShapeField-derived classes such as TextField or ImageField.

ShapeFields typically describe behavior rather than store instance information about themselves. For example, the "value" property can be described using a domain property and the "bounds" property can be described by anchoring styles. By doing so, ShapeFields do not have to be instanced per-Shape, and as a result are very lightweight.
To instance ShapeFields for a particular ShapeElement type, override the method InitializeShapeFields in your ShapeElement-derived class.
ShapeFields can be associated with a domain property of any ModelElement. As the domain property value changes, the associated ShapeFields automatically update with it.
To connect a ShapeField up with a domain property, call the ShapeField method AssociateValueWith after creating the ShapeField.

member.summary:
Retrieves a mouse action that should be made active on the next MouseDown event if the mouse is over the specified point.
By default, this method will return the SelectAction. If the field's CanEditValue returns true and the field is already focused, then the InvokeEditorAction will be returned instead.
member.param: The MouseButtons depressed.
Mouse position relative to Diagram's top-left in world units.
The hit test information that corresponds to the mouse position.
member.returns: The mouse action that should be made active on the next MouseDown event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeSubField
member.summary:
A sub component of a ShapeField that is optionally selectable, focusable, hit-testable, in-place-editable, and IAccessible. Examples of a ShapeSubField are list items in a list field, grid cells and grid lines in a grid field, and radio buttons in a radio button group.
ShapeSubFields are only created as needed. For example, a grid containing 10,000 cells only needs to create a subfield for a cell when the subfield is selected, focused, hit-tested, edited, or accessed via IAccessible.
A future enhancement is to allow a subfield to represent multiple elements. For example, a single subfield could represent an entire column in a grid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.StyleSet
member.summary:
A StyleSet is a collection of graphics objects that can be used by an application to specify a set of pens, brushes, and fonts to be used for all of the drawing operations. Within the painting code, you can call StyleSet.GetPen to retrieve a specific pen defined by the system. That pen will be set to the correct color and style defined with the application. Use that pen immediately as it is unique. If you need to hold onto a pen use GetPenCopy.
StyleSets can live at multiple levels in the system. There's an ApplicationStyleSet which are the app defined defaults style scheme. There are also ClassStyleSets which exist at the class type level to specify styles for all instances of that class of shape. There can also exist instance StyleSets which contains resource information for each instance of a shape. This should be used when different instances of the same class of shapes can have different appearance.
When actually trying to retrieve an object, like a Pen, the StyleSet code goes up the inheritance chain from instance to class to application StyleSets until if finds that first one that contains that resource that you're looking for (as defined by the ResourceId that you're asking for).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.StyleSet.GetFontHeight(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.StyleSetResourceId)
member.summary: Returns the line spacing of the specified font (i.e., the height of a line of text) in world units. Line spacing is the ascent + the descent + some recommended extra. The ascent is the height of the character above the baseline, and the descent is the height of the character below the baseline. The extra is below the descent.
member.param: The id of the font.
member.returns: The font height which can be used for spacing successive lines of text.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ApplicationStyleSet
member.summary: The ApplicationStyleSet is a singleton class the represents the basic styles set up by the system. These styles are pens, brushes, and fonts that can be used throughout the Design Surface. Specific designers cannot override pens in the ApplicationStyleSet.

Whether we're going into high contrast or not.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet
member.summary: The DefaultStyleSet is a singleton class the represents the basic styles set up by the system. These styles are pens, brushes, and fonts that can be used throughout the Design Surface. Specific designers cannot override pens in the DefaultStyleSet by calling the OverridePen, OverrideBrush, and OverrideFont methods. These are the base color schemes for the design surface, but designers can override their specific color scheme in the Diagram style set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor that creates the application's StyleSet. Since this is a singleton class, its constructor is set to private, so all access to this class must be done through the ApplicationStyleSet.StyleSet property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet.StyleSet
member.summary: Gets the single instance of the ApplicationStyleSet.
member.value: The ApplicationStyleSet for this process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet.DefaultBaseFontSize
member.summary: Gets the default base font size. This size is what all font sizes within the DefaultStyleSet are sized relative to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet.InitializeDefaultPens
member.summary: Initializes all of the Default pens.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet.InitializeDefaultBrushes
member.summary: Initializes all of the DefaultStyleSet brushes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DefaultStyleSet.InitializeDefaultFonts
member.summary: Initializes all of the ApplicationStyleSet fonts.

member.summary: Gets the em height of the Font object measured in the units of the Font object. This is the value used to create the font. Use FontHeight instead if you want to get the height of a line of text using this font (i.e., the line spacing).
member.value: Returns the em height of the Font object measured in the units of the Font object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.FontDescriptor.FontHeight
member.summary: Gets the line spacing of this font (i.e., the height of a line of text) in world units. Line spacing is the ascent + the descent + some recommended extra. The ascent is the height of the character above the baseline, and the descent is the height of the character below the baseline. The extra is below the descent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PenDescriptor
member.summary: PenDescriptor class holds the PenStyleSetInfo for a class and an instance of the Pen described by that info (if it's already been created). The PenDescriptor is what gets cached for later use.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PenDescriptor.PenStyleSetInfo
member.summary: Gets the Pen information for this descriptor.
member.value: A PenStyleSetInfo for this descriptor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PenDescriptor.Pen
member.summary: Gets a cloned instance of the Pen defined by this descriptor. If the pen has not been previously created, it creates it first. This is a singleton. Do not dispose - this will crash! Use immediately.
member.value: A Pen defined by this descriptor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PenDescriptor.PenFromPenStyleSetInfo
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Pen from its PenStyleSetInfo description.
member.returns: A new Pen instance created from its PenStyleSetInfo.

member.summary: Flags to specify which Pen settings have been overridden or made immutable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PenSettings
member.summary: PenSettings allows certain properties on a PenStyleSetInfo to be marked as overridden or immutable. If certain Pen settings are marked as immutable, then they are not allowed to be changed again.

member.summary: Gets the overridden properties in the PenStyleSetInfo.

member.value: A PenSettingsFlags for the immutable PenStyleSetInfo properties.

member.value: A PenStyleSetInfo associated with this PenSettings object.

member.summary: Makes the Alignment setting immutable, unchangeable by others. Once it's make immutable, no one else can change it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.TextField
member.summary: A ShapeField which can display text in a ShapeElement.
member.remarks: If you want to display items such as text or images within a ShapeElement, instantiate ShapeField-derived classes such as TextField or ImageField.

ShapeFields typically describe these displayable items rather than store instance information about them. For example, the value property can be described using an IMS property and the bounds property can be described by anchoring styles. By doing so, ShapeFields can be static members of a ShapeElement-derived class and as a result are very lightweight.
To create ShapeFields for a particular ShapeElement type, override the method InitializeShapeFields in your ShapeElement-derived class.
ShapeFields can be associated with an IMS property of the parent ShapeElement. As the IMS property value changes, the associated ShapeFields automatically update with it.
To connect a ShapeField up with an IMS property, call the ShapeField method AssociateValueWith after creating the ShapeField.
ShapeFields can be in-place editable as well.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.TextField.GetFontHeight(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ShapeElement)
member.summary: Gets the line spacing of this font (i.e., the height of a line of text) in world units. Line spacing is the ascent + the descent + some recommended extra. The ascent is the height of the character above the baseline, and the descent is the height of the character below the baseline. The extra is below the descent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ToolboxAction.GetCursor(System.Windows.Forms.Cursor,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DiagramClientView,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.PointD)
member.summary: Gets the cursor to display at the specified mouse position.
member.param: The existing cursor.
The DiagramClientView requesting the cursor.
The cursor position in world units relative to the top-left of the diagram.
member.returns: The cursor to display at the specified mouse position.
member.remarks: This method is called by the DiagramClientView if this MouseAction is active or if it is the potential MouseAction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ToolboxAction.OnMouseMove(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DiagramMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Called when a MouseMove event has been dispatched to this MouseAction.
member.param: A DiagramMouseEventArgs that contains event data.
member.remarks: This method selects the mouse cursor because DiagramMouseEventArgs contains important hit-test information. The selected cursor is set via GetCursor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ToolboxAction.OnMouseActionDeactivated(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.DiagramEventArgs)
member.summary: Called when this MouseAction has been deactivated.
member.param: A DiagramEventArgs that contains event data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.ToolboxAction.OnClicked(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.MouseActionEventArgs)
member.summary: Called when this MouseAction has received a non-dragging MouseDown + MouseUp combination or when it has received a Complete event.
member.param: A MouseActionEventArgs that contains event data.
member.remarks: Set e.ActionRequest to ActionRequest.CompleteAction to complete the MouseAction and deactivate it.
Set e.ActionRequest to ActionRequest.CancelAction to cancel the MouseAction and deactivate it.
Set e.ActionRequest to ActionRequest.ContinueAction to keep the MouseAction active. This will place the MouseAction in the hovering state.

member.summary: Miscellaneous constants used by the graph layout engine

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzReal
member.summary: Delta value used for floating point comparisons where values are really supposed to be equal, i.e. approximately the smallest difference representable as a double

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzGeneral
member.summary: Tolerance value used for floating point comparisons where values are considered equal within normal tolerance, i.e. to within nine decimal digits

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzDistance
member.summary: Delta value used for floating point comparisons of gemoetric values

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzDegrees
member.summary: Tolerance value used for floating point comparisons of angles measured in degrees
member.remarks: One arc second in degrees

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzRadians
member.summary: Tolerance value used for floating point comparisons of angles measured in radians
member.remarks: One arc second in redians

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzEqual(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines whether two floating point values are considered equal within a specified tolerance
member.param: first value to compare
second value to compare
tolerance - must be positive
member.returns: true if the first and second values differ by no more than the fuzz value

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.FuzzZero(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Determines whether a floating point value should be considered equal to zero within a specified tolerance
member.param: value to compare with zero
tolerance - must be positive
member.returns: true if the value differs by no more than the fuzz value from zero

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.PI
member.summary: The approximation of PI used in the layout engine

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.LargeReal
member.summary: About the largest scale that can generally produce math good results

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.LargeGeneral
member.summary: Very large generally useful number for size

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.Diagrams.GraphObject.VGConstants.LargeDistance
member.summary: Large distance (e.g. delta x/y)
